Subsume the Spirit ends immediately if the character travels more than 10 miles away from her native body, if the character’s native body takes damage, or if the animal she’s controlling takes damage.

Animals do not take damage from sunlight even when controlled by a vampire. However, a vampire with Beast traits still risks frenzy. For more information on frenzy, see Chapter Seven: Dramatic Systems, page 301.
None

You can use the first 2 dots of your Mental and Social in-clan disciplines while employing Subsume the Spirit. If you are controlling a ghouled animal, you can spend up to 5 Blood to fuel these in-clan disciplines, at the rate of 1 Blood a turn, regardless of the character’s generation. Vampires with this focus who have Animalism in-clan can activate Subsume the Spirit while in Subsume the Spirit, thus transferring directly from one animal body to another. Each new use of Subsume the Spirit requires 1 Blood point, a standard action, eye-to-eye contact, and an opposed challenge (as per the standard use of this power).
None

fields.testPool: None

fields.title: Animalism

content.value: “Being a predator requires more than physical brutality. True savagery is a state of mind.” — Archon Gates

When a vampire is Embraced, her soul is burdened with a dark, primal instinct: the Beast. The Beast makes her a predator, driving her to savage acts in order to survive. Some vampires 
resist their Beasts, while others delight in their new, animalistic nature. By drawing on this feral instinct and predatory drive, a vampire can communicate with and control animals, establishing a mastery over more primitive beasts.

Animalism can be used on birds, mammals, marsupials, and fish. It cannot be used on insects, nor on creatures whose minds are too simple to understand rudimentary communication, such as mollusks or worms.

fields.testPool: The character wielding Animalism uses her Social attribute + Animal Ken versus the target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Lash Out

content.value: The second stage of grief is anger, the most primordial response to the danger of external threats. The surge of adrenaline it provides helps the body defend itself from attackers and bends the psyche toward aggression. In other circumstances, rage is a hindrance, causing one to lash out in the absence of an actual threat and alienating oneself from others. With respect to grief, anger has a masking effect, used to protect the psyche from feelings of vulnerability and sadness that it lacks the strength to process.

Spend 1 point of Blood, your standard action, and make a contested challenge as you make a remark to your target about her mortality. For example, you may say “Your temper’s going to get you into trouble someday,” “Your rashness will be the death of you,” or simply “Memento Mori” if you have a flare for the dramatic. You must have your target’s gaze and focus to use this power. If successful, for the next hour, your target is susceptible to rage frenzy as if she had 3 Beast traits more than her current total.

Therefore, even if she has zero Beast Traits, she is susceptible to additional triggers for frenzy, including the need to test for frenzy if she takes 2 points of damage from a single source (see
MET VTM, Chapter Seven: Dramatic Systems, page 301

). This penalty only applies to determining frenzy; it is not applied to determine if degeneration occurs. This penalty is cumulative with other modifiers that give a penalty to Beast traits, such as the Brujah clan weakness and the Short Fuse flaw.

In addition, if your target is on the receiving end of any action which could be construed as moderately disrespectful, she must spend a point of Willpower or immediately act out in a noticeable fashion. Appropriate actions include attacking, yelling, breaking something, or storming out. If she spends a point of Willpower, she may ignore the source of disrespect and all other similar affronts for 5 minutes.

This power affects supernatural creatures and non-vampires equally. Werewolves are considered to have 3 additional levels of rage for determining frenzy. Even if your target does not have a Beast, she will enter a mental state identical in all ways to a vampire’s rage frenzy, attacking the source of her rage.

fields.exceptional: Your target must test for rage frenzy as if she had 4 additional Beast traits; therefore, she must test whenever she takes a single point of damage.

content.value: You may target up to 3 individuals with this power if you have their Gaze and Focus. Should you expend a point of Willpower to retest any of these opposed challenges, you also gain that retest for the remainder of the opposed challenges without spending further Willpower. If you spend the Willpower to retest after some challenges are already resolved, you cannot go back to previous challenges you lost to apply that Willpower retest retroactively.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Psychic Assault

content.value: Most uses of the Sight are subtle, gathering information or passing thoughts in a gentle and inconspicuous manner. Psychic Assault is none of these things. A vampire who masters this power has the capacity to attack another individual using the strength of her mental acuity, hammering on her unfortunate subject with an incomprehensible barrage of will and thought.

Spend 1 Blood and expend a standard action to attack your opponent’s mind with Psychic Assault. Make an opposed challenge against your opponent, using the Auspex test pool. If you succeed, your victim takes 4 points of normal damage. The damage dealt by Psychic Assault cannot be reduced or negated by armor or supernatural resistances, such as Fortitude.
A character attacked by a Psychic Assault immediately knows where the attack originated and from which individual in that location (if more than one person is in the area). You can repeatedly activate Psychic Assault against the same target; this is an exception to the rule that prohibits a character from using a power on the same target immediately after failing. If you fail a Psychic Assault against an opponent, you can try again against that same opponent  (or someone else) on the next turn.
Your Psychic Assault deals 5 points of normal damage, instead of 4.

fields.testPool: : The vampire wielding Auspex uses her  Mental attribute + Investigation versus the target’s Mental  attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Soul Detonation

content.value: The process of creating a Dark Vessel twists and distorts the Corpus of a Wraith, leaving it on the verge of a Harrowing. Shattering a Dark Vessel in just the right way allows the energy of a Harrowing to be released in a chaotic blast of entropy.

Once learned this power can always be used to augment your Dark Vessels, turning them into potent projectiles. Spend your standard action to imbue the object with dark energies and throw it at an individual within 10 steps. To do so, initiate an opposed challenge using your Physical attribute + Athletics skill versus your target’s Physical attribute + Dodge skill. If you succeed in the challenge your target is struck by the vessel. Upon impact, a small nihil opens that pulls the object and the wraith to Oblivion. The target takes 3 points of normal damage and loses 1 point of Willpower.

You may use this power during Celerity rounds. Using this power destroys the Dark Vessel, regardless of whether or not you succeed in the opposed challenge. Objects destroyed in this way cannot confer the benefits of the Dark Vessel’s power.

fields.exceptional: Your target loses 1 point of Willpower and takes 4 points of normal damage instead of 3.

content.value: If you fail the opposed challenge when throwing a Dark Vessel at your target but manage to win or tie one of the tests, your target is grazed by the vessel. She takes no damage, but still loses 1 point of Willpower.

As a skilled necromancer you can manipulate the energy found in a wraith to alter mundane objects within the waking world. Once bound within its new prison, the wraith has no choice but to perform the desired function. With this ability, you can punish or award wraiths while using their innate energy to further your own agenda.

Once you have learned this power you can create Deathly Devices, imprisoning the soul of a wraith into a piece of equipment. Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action as you target a nearby wraith. If you succeed in an opposed challenge, the wraith becomes bound to the object as its corpus is absorbed. Only Stock NPCs of level 4 or lower can be bound within a Deathly Device. The Storyteller may also rule that this power does not work on specific wraiths of her choosing.
Choose one of the following effects:
Powered

: Wraiths bound to this item imbue it with their own ghostly energy, bringing it to life without any external force. The item does not require batteries, gasoline, electricity, or any other source of power to function. The wraiths energy can power small devices like remote controlled cars or music boxes, or large devices such as windmills or vehicles.
Dysfunctional

: Wraiths bound to this item squeeze into the crevices, causing it to malfunction and stutter to an inexplicable stop. For the duration of the wraiths binding, the device will not function. Computers will not turn on, cars will not start, and pacemakers will shut down.
Conscription

: Wraiths bound to this item must seek to fulfill set orders before she can gain her freedom. While the wraith can control the object and act independently, it may act in ways that would compromise the item in order to fulfill the instructions. For example, a wraith bound to a gun and commanded to shoot a specific vampire will attempt to do so when the opportunity arises — whether the user wants it to or not. Once she does, she is released. The Storyteller will determine how any wraiths bound in this manner behave.
Enduring

: The item is magically enhanced by the wraith making it more difficult to destroy. As a result, the item can only be destroyed by supernaturally means — magical items or characters using an appropriate Discipline.
Symbiote

: The item is magically enhanced by a wraith who is familiar with its usage. The item grants a +1 bonus to your test pool when used for its intended purpose. This bonus cannot be used during combat. For example, a set of lock-picks gives you a +1 bonus when using the Security skill to pick a lock, but a sword that imprisons a wraith does not grant any Melee skill bonus.

Unless you have the focus, you may only create a total number of Deathly Devices equal to your rating in this Path (so a maximum of 5). Creating new devices beyond this will free the wraith contained in the oldest one. You may use Deathly Devices created either by you or by another necromancer with this Path. If someone without the Deathly Device power  attempts to use a Deathly Device, they do not receive any benefits conveyed by Path of Soul Bonding.
You may create a total number of Deathly Devices up to twice your number of dots in this path, to a maximum of 10.

fields.title: Compellling Offer

content.value: The bargaining stage is the psyche’s attempt to cope with mortality and grief – the product of realization giving way to desperation. Individuals in this state are immensely pliable, eager to explore any option to avert catastrophe. With this power, your target gains a sense of mortal anxiety that becomes a state of mind that you can exploit to your advantage.

This power allows you to make an offer which weighs on your target’s mind until she makes a decision. Spend 1 point of Blood and three or more standard actions as you make an offer to your target. You must have your target’s Gaze and Focus to use this power, and you must be able to communicate with her (telepathically is fine). Thereafter, the choice presented lingers in the target's mind, always at the edge of her thinking.

Once the offer is made and until your target makes her choice, she may not take any antagonistic action toward you, which includes targeting you with hostile powers or attacking you. She may, however, seek to negotiate. You may act against her normally during this time, and she must continue to consider the offer. If you withdraw the offer by spending a simple action, this power’s effects end.
The target may exercise one of the following options at any time:
Reject the Offer
: Your target may spend 2 points of Willpower at any time to reject the offer. The power ends and she may act normally without restriction from this power.
Accept the Offer

: Your target can accept either the initial offer or the negotiated terms of one mutually agreed upon. Once accepted, she remains unable to take hostile action toward you until the end of the night or until the terms are fulfilled, whichever comes first. If you take hostile action against the target or if you fail to uphold the arrangement, the effects of the power end. The target cannot violate the agreement without spending 2 points of Willpower. If she does, the effects of the power end.

Offers may not be designed to be life threatening to your target. You are free to describe an offer in shorter or longer terms, making an offer that either ends sooner than the end of the night, or a more open offer that would seemingly last beyond the current night. However, when the offer expires or the night ends (whichever is first), the effects of this power fade.

A target may only be affected by a single use of this power per night. Any additional use of this power from you or from anyone else upon the same target will fail. You may not use this power on friendly targets purely with the intent of triggering this limitation; the Storyteller may intervene in instances where she believes this is the case.

You may only have a single active offer at a given time. Any additional offers end the effects of the current one. This power does not work if the offer is farcical or clearly intended to insult or ridicule, the determination of which is subject to the Storyteller’s discretion. This includes offers involving vulgarity or demeaning acts.

You may instead have a number of active offers equal to your dots in Occult plus one. Any additional offers require you to choose an active offer to end. When using Compelling Offer, you may make the same offer to multiple parties at once, provided you have each target’s Gaze and Focus and can communicate with them. These targets count individually toward your maximum number of active offers.

Example: 
In the early evening, Mariella arrives in a small town that a roving group of Anarchs is occupying. Their presence is making work difficult at the local quarry that provides materials to a variety of her construction projects. She wants to convince them to leave.

She finds the bar where the Baron spends her time. Outside, she sees a pair of rough looking thugs. She chats them up and decides to offer them a deal: they should leave the gang and come and work for her. She uses Compelling Offer and has the Charisma focus, allowing her to affect both thugs. The two say they will think it over.  She enters the bar and engages in negotiations with the Baron. Mariella offers her $50,000 if she and her gang will leave town that night and uses Compelling Offer once again. She tells the Baron if she does not accept, her next offer won’t be so nice. The Baron is angered and spends 2 points of Willpower to reject the offer. She stands and yells for her thugs to grab Mariella. The thugs enter; however, they cannot attack Mariella as her earlier offer lingers in their minds. The Baron is incensed but does not want to fight Mariella one on one. Mariella smiles and tells the thugs to leave. To the Baron’s surprise, they oblige.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Harvest Despair

content.value: The depression that follows grief brings with it a sense of futility and
despair

. In this state, the mind expends energy yet accomplishes nothing, sabotaged by its own efforts. With this power, you can harvest this energy, turning it into useful sustenance. A number of Giovanni have come to appreciate the vitae created through this magic, noting its flavorful salty notes.

Spend 1 point of Blood and a simple action to activate this power. For the next 10 minutes, whenever you are involved in an opposed challenge against a visible target, you may announce the use of Harvest Despair before any tests are thrown. If you do, you receive a -5 penalty to your test pool for the challenge. However, if you win despite the penalty your opponent feels a sense of futility and despair as she is assailed by entropic forces. She loses a point of Willpower and up to 2 points of Blood, both of which you may absorb to restore any of your own spent points. If your target is not a vampire, she instead loses the type of fuel appropriate to her creature type (such as Gnosis for werewolves or Glamour for changelings) , which you absorb as blood. If instead your target has no Willpower to lose or if she’s a Stock NPC without Willpower, she must immediately cease attacking you, and cannot do so again until this power’s duration is over. You may only benefit from this power once per turn, but you may announce its use during Celerity rounds if you have already activated it. If you use this power but fail in the challenge, you may still use it again on subsequent challenges in the same turn until you succeed.

You may only benefit from this power when used against a target who wishes you genuine harm. It will not work if you activate it and then invite allies or otherwise friendly people to hit you, nor will the power function in contrived scenarios. The blood generated from this power is considered inert and does not create a blood bond. This power is not considered hostile for the purposes of powers such as Entrancement or Majesty.
By activating this power you take a -3 penalty instead of a -5 penalty.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: Accept Death’s Embrace

content.value: For every living and unliving being, death is an inevitable truth. As the final stage of grief, acceptance is the realization of that truth – a state of release where the psyche is freed from the ego and prepares itself for what lies beyond. Some have described this state of mind as immensely liberating; a blissful window of clarity wherein they were finally able to find themselves.

Spend a point of Blood and your standard action as you inform your target of her imminent demise. You must have your target’s Gaze and Focus to use this power. If you succeed in an opposed challenge, for the next 10 minutes your target’s psyche is overcome with the certainty that her life is about to end and must choose the circumstances as to how she will perish. She must select from one of the following restrictions and inform the Storyteller privately of her choice (inform her she should not tell you which restriction she has chosen). Should she be attacked or become threatened, the chosen restriction will apply.
Desperate Escape

: The target will seek to escape as a means of prolonging her life. Until she either dies or escapes all pursuers, she must devote every action to fleeing the scene or taking actions in support of that effort, including evading her pursuers. She may only initiate opposed challenges to facilitate her escape, such as the use of Mesmerism to order a guard out of her way. In the event escape is physically impossible, she may choose to fight until another option presents itself.
Last Stand

: The target seeks a valiant demise, choosing to confront death head on. Until her attackers are either all dead or have fled, she may not attempt to withdraw or flee. She must spend every action attempting to incapacitate her attackers and, if they are within sight but not within her range to attack, she must move toward them. She may still maneuver to obtain a more advantageous position, making use of cover or choke points, activate combat powers, or calling for help. Should her attackers surrender or flee, she is not obliged to pursue them. Once all attackers are incapacitated, have surrendered, or are no longer visible, she may act normally.
Stoic Resolve

: The target embraces her end with dignity, choosing to offer a token resistance. She may fight or flee as she prefers, but she may not spend Blood to heal, will not accept the Assist Defender combat maneuver or call for help, and cannot consent to the use of powers by allies to aid her.

While the player may choose freely, this is not a conscious choice for her character. Therefore, she cannot be coerced into a specific option through the use of Dominate or other powers. However, once she has chosen, she will immediately suspect her life is at risk. She will know what her restriction is, and may act in advance of being directly threatened to preserve her life.

A character under the effects of this power may not relent to powers which might compel her to act against her restriction, such as Dominate or Dread Gaze, but she is affected by them normally. In the event of a stalemate, such as if the target wishes to fight but her opponents remain out of reach and visible, she is not obliged to take any action and can act freely until circumstances change.

fields.exceptional: You may eliminate one of the three options as a choice for your target. She may only choose from the remaining two options.

content.value: The Storyteller will inform you which of the options your target has chosen. You may inquire discreetly through the Storyteller so that your target does not know that you are aware of her choice.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

fields.title: The Path of Grief

content.value: “Grief is a weapon and a tool.  With this act, I am allowing you to decide.” —
Jacob Elghinn, clan Giovanni

Having taken note of the advances over the past decades in the Thaumaturgical arts, the Giovanni have likewise spent  years  seeking to expand the powers of Necromancy to embrace modern science and technology.  Based on the model of grief studies pioneered by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross, The Path of Grief draws on the psyche’s connection to death and uses necromantic energies to bring those emotions to the surface. Just as the departure of a family member can elicit a variety of reactions from sadness to relief to anger, so too can grief serve as a gateway to a variety of complex responses.

Immensely popular with Giovanni advisors and negotiators who use The Path of Grief to their advantage in business and social settings, this path invokes the fear of death in a variety of ways, from mild distress to crushing depression.  A person affected by this power finds these feelings to be overwhelming to such an extent that they cannot help but exhibit outward signs. While the character retains their agency with regard to the specifics of their behavior, their motivations become greatly skewed and their resulting actions should adhere to the templates described below.

fields.testPool: Social attribute + Occult skill versus target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

content.value: For a clan with power over time, the Sages so often seem to lack it. Since the rift in their clan first formed, they have feared the pretenders and their Celerity, terrified at the effortless speed they came to manifest without study of  the forces they manipulate. Although this power is the height of Temporis and the greatest expression of speed it can muster, the Sages fear Celerity will find a way to be faster still. Practitioners who have attempted to push beyond the bounds of this power have reported seeing bizarre visions and mysterious figures silently warning them to stop. Those rumored to have ignored such warnings have never returned to tell their tale.

Whenever you activate Clotho's Gift you gain one additional round of actions to be resolved during the third Celerity round. In addition, you may use an additional one of your actions granted by Clotho's Gift to activate a Mental or Social power. For example, if you have the Stamina focus, you may use a total of 2 of your additional actions on Mental or Social powers. If you do not have the Stamina focus, you may use one of your additional actions in this way. This is an exception to the rule that states you cannot use Mental or Social powers during Celerity rounds.

Archetypal concepts of death and money are often intertwined, with deities such as Hades and Baron Samedi having jurisdiction over wealth in addition to the afterlife. To these figures, the souls of the departed are theirs to claim, pledged either through willful agreement or ancient laws. By leveraging these debts, you exert power over those who drift closer to death, assailing them with necrotic energies.

Spend a simple action to visibly point to your target as you make her mortality the subject of your attention. Thereafter, whenever she spends or loses a point of Willpower in your presence you gain a +1 wild card bonus in offensive challenges against her for each point of Willpower she has spent or lost over the next 10 minutes, up to a maximum of 5 points. In addition, she retains your Gaze and Focus throughout this period of time.

You may only have one designated target at a time. If you choose an additional target, any effects against your previous target fade and the count of how many times she spent Willpower in your presence resets.

In addition to the above benefit, if your target spends a point of Willpower for a retest in a challenge where you are the attacker or the defender, you may regain a single point of spent Willpower. You may only benefit from this effect once per turn.

Good help is hard to find, and often that help is easily distracted and turned against you. With your mastery of Dominate, you no longer have to worry. When commanding a group, your allies no longer have to rely just on their own mental faculties to stay on task and follow orders. Instead, your commands create a hive mind allowing the group to resist distractions and enemy orders, and to share Willpower.

Spend 3 points of Blood and a standard action giving an order to a number of willing allies up to your dots in the Leadership skill. The order given must be specific and direct, such as “fan out and find him,” or “protect me at all costs.” Intentionally vague commands such as “resist anyone who tries to influence you” do not work with this power. While this power is in effect each ally affected by Mob Rule gets a +1 wild card bonus per participant in the mob to resist any Mental or Social challenge that would reasonably prevent her from following your order.

In addition, members of your mob gain access to a bonus pool of Willpower equal to your dots in the Leadership skill. Participants may spend from this pool instead of using their own Willpower provided it is in support of the group’s directive. This access to additional Willpower does not add to any test pool. Spending bonus Willpower does not require an action and may take place outside initiative order.  In order to benefit from these bonuses a character must be actively following the order you gave.

If a member of the mob deviates from your directive, is incapacitated, or killed, she no longer has the benefits of this power, her Willpower is no longer shareable, and the mob must reduce their wild card bonus by one.  If the objective of your order is complete or no longer viable, the benefits of this power end for everyone in the mob.

This power lasts for 1 hour. You may only have a single instance of this power active at a given time. Likewise, a character may only be part of a single mob at a given time. You may not use this power on yourself.

The Heartsblood is a great magical well situated in the Assamite fortress of Alamut that is filled with vitae from all Assamites that have ever visited the mountain fortress. You are able to tap into this magical well, calling upon the collective might of the clan, though not without cost. Some speculate the overuse of this power is responsible for the zealotry shown by so many Assamite elders.

Once this power is learned, you are able to extract blood through a mystic connection to a seemingly endless source of vitae. You may spend up to 2 additional points of Blood per turn in excess of your generational limits, drawing from the Heartsblood rather than from your own body. Doing so preserves your own Blood pool and draws upon the ancestral blood of your clan. You must actively spend this Blood; it cannot be used to restore your Blood pool or to feed others.

However, this process is not without cost. The first time each night you Awaken the Heartsblood you immediately gain a compulsion derangement with the trigger of the Laws of Haqim that lasts the remainder of the night. You feel compelled to both act and advocate that others act in accordance with the laws as described below. Consuming the Heartsblood in this way does not create a blood bond nor does it count as drinking vampiric blood for the purpose of the Assamite clan weakness as it has been magically purified.
Although you have access to a vast supply of blood, you still experience hunger in the same manner and receive no relief from the effects of hunger and hunger frenzies by invoking this power.
The Laws of Haqim
The Law of Leadership-
Honor the Eldest among you, for he is to rule my House when I am absent.
The Law of Protection-
Ward the mortals from Caine’s descendants and treat them with honor in all things.
The Law of Destruction-
Slay not those of the Blood, for that judgment is for the Eldest alone.
The Law of the Word-
Deceive not those of the Blood, for my house is founded on truth.
The Law of Judgment-
Judge those of Caine’s blood and punish them should they be found wanting.

Syzygy is the alignment of astronomical objects that occurs during an eclipse or an occultation. The act of two celestial bodies joined in cosmic dance bears special meaning in astrology, symbolizing a rare union of special significance. You can create a temporary union between yourself and another, intertwining your fates for a brief period of time.
Spend 1 point of Blood and your standard action to make an opposed challenge as you seek to magically splice two fates together. If you succeed, you and your target become
Attuned

to each other. While you and your target are Attuned, any negative supernatural power currently affecting you also affects her. For example, if you are suffering from the Dementation power The Haunting, your target likewise suffers from it. If your target is the source of the negative power, she may choose to end the effects normally.
This power lasts for 1 hour or until you have lost sight of your target for 5 turns.

While Attuned, you may gain the positive benefit of one supernatural power from which your target is currently benefiting. This must be a standard power from levels 1 through 5 or a technique; you may not gain the benefits of elder or Luminary powers in this way. You do not need to know the precise name of the power, but you do need to be aware of it. This positive benefit lasts until your chosen target no longer benefits from it or no longer has it active. Bonuses that do not originate from powers, such as a werewolf’s innate shapeshifting or merits, cannot be duplicated. Note that each level of Celerity, Potence, and Fortitude are counted as separate powers, and you may not benefit from the same power twice. If the chosen power’s duration ends, you may spend a simple action to choose a new power.

This power only deals with active powers that have a duration of one day or less and not lingering effects such as the blood bond, Conditioning, or rituals such as Blood Contract. In addition, it only transfers status-related effects of powers and not physical effects or damage. For example, the damaging effects of Psychic Assault, Withering, or Engulf are not transferred, but if you are subjected to Dagon’s Call and an Attuned target spends Blood, she would take damage from Dagon’s Call.

If the target of this power uses or has used any powers that are affecting you, you are considered the originator of powers that affect her through Syzygy. For example, if another character uses Dread Gaze on you and (once cornered) you use Syzygy on her, you must avoid her, and she must avoid you. If you are affected by a power from a third party, that third party remains the originator. For example, if another character uses Entrancement on you and you use Syzygy on another target, both you and your target are Entranced to the third character. As the conduit, the effects are one way; you are not affected by any powers affecting your target.

If an effect you are under expires or ends, it immediately ends for any target you are Attuned to. You may only have a single instance of this power active at a given time with a new application replacing your previous instance.

fields.title: Necromantic Rituals

content.value: “Life is nothing but a ﬂeeting moment of pain before inevitable eternity. In death, we are truly born.” — Agaitas, childe of Egothha

Rituals are necromantic formulas that create powerful magical effects. They make use of unusual and rare ingredients, and take signiﬁcantly more time to cast than the simple spells of a necromantic path. All practitioners of Necromancy have the capacity to perform rituals equivalent to their mastery with that art.

Rituals must be learned and purchased separately from paths; you do not acquire them simply by purchasing a path of Necromancy . Like paths, they are rated from levels 1-5, and a caster can have several rituals corresponding to each level of the progression. A necromancer must purchase one ritual of each level before she is able to purchase a ritual at the next-higher level.  So, in order to purchase a level 2 ritual, a necromancer must already possess at least one level 1 ritual; or in order to purchase a level 3 ritual, she must already possess at least one level 2 ritual, and so forth.

No character can learn more necromantic rituals than she possesses dots in all of her Necromancy paths. Total all your dots from all known paths of Necromancy to determine the maximum number of rituals your character can possess.
Unless otherwise stated, all rituals  cost 1 Blood to activate. All rituals also require ﬁve minutes of casting time per level of the ritual.

Ritual Ingredients and Targeting : If a ritual requires you to have a focus, then it can be used at range. Otherwise, it requires line of sight, unless the ritual speciﬁcally says otherwise. Ingredients that are speciﬁcally called out in the ritual’s description must be used to cast the ritual, or that ritual fails. A ritual’s ingredients are always consumed in a use of that ritual, unless otherwise speciﬁed in the description.


To see all Necromantic Rituals, go to our Rituals Page and filter for Necromancy, or
click on the link here!

fields.testPool: Necromancy user’s Social attribute + Occult versus the target’s Social attribute + Willpower.

content.value: “Intelligence is power. It is the ﬂame behind innovation, a light that shows the path to the future. Without the efforts of the mind, the world is lost.” — Myrsus ibn Sharbel

Rituals are mystical formulas that create powerful magical effects. They make use of unusual and rare ingredients, and take signiﬁcantly more time to cast than the simple spells of a path of Thaumaturgy. All practitioners of Thaumaturgy have the capacity to perform rituals equivalent to their mastery with that art.

Rituals must be learned and purchased separately from paths; you do not acquire them simply by purchasing a path of Thaumaturgy . Like paths, they are rated from levels 1-5, and a caster can have several rituals corresponding to each level of the progression. A thaumaturge must purchase one ritual of each level before she is able to purchase a ritual at the next-higher level.  So, in order to purchase a level 2 ritual, a thaumaturge must already possess at least one level 1 ritual, or in order to purchase a level 3 ritual, she must already possess at least one level 2 ritual, and so forth.

No character can learn more thaumaturgic rituals than she possesses dots in all of her paths of Thaumaturgy. Total all your dots from all known paths of Thaumaturgy to determine the maximum number of rituals your character can possess.

For example, Regent Insolens possesses 4 dots in Thaumaturgy: Path of Blood (his primary path), 3 dots in Thaumaturgy: Path of Conjuring, and 2 dots in Thaumaturgy: The Lure of Flames, and thus can learn up to nine Thaumaturgy rituals.
Unless otherwise stated, all rituals cost 1 Blood to activate. All rituals also require ﬁve minutes of casting time per level of the ritual.

Ritual Ingredients and Targeting : If a ritual requires you to have a focus, then it can be used at range. Otherwise, it requires line of sight, unless the ritual speciﬁcally says otherwise. Ingredients that are speciﬁcally called out in the ritual’s  description must be used when casting the ritual. If you do not have a point of your target’s Blood, and the ritual requires it, you cannot use the ritual on that target. A ritual’s ingredients are always consumed in the use of the ritual, unless otherwise speciﬁed in the description.


To see all Thaumaturgical Rituals, go to our Rituals Page and filter for Thaumaturgy, or
